page.title: 12Werrington Police Station
page.content: The Werrington Police Station caters for Werrington,Wetley Rocks,Cellarhead, Hulme and parts of Bucknall.It was established in 1901,but a new station was built in 1952,with their first vehicle arriving in 1968.It is manned by 3 constables who are always on call, 24 hours a day. The population of Werrington is 8400,which is double the number it was 25 years ago.Cheadle Police Station is the main station in the Werrington area.Werrington is just off the A52,which also passes through Wetley Rocks and Cellarhead. Most calls are road accidents, which average 2 a week.Theft and burgalary are the crimes of greatest concern.Half of the emergency calls are not serious enough to warrant concern.
